Class GamingMachineTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • casino.gamingmachine.GamingMachineTest

  • public class GamingMachineTest
extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void FAILED_TEST_WITH_EXPLANATION() 
      void setUp() 
      void ShouldConnectCardToAGamingMachine()
      A gambler card (card) can be stored at a gaming machine.
      void ShouldDisconnectCardFromAGamingMachine()
      A gambler card (card) can be disconnected from a gaming machine.
      void ShouldEmptyListAfterAround()
      A requirement is to have logic, where after a betting round has finished, all bets that were recorded on this machine (person can make several bets), are erased.
      void ShouldKeepTrackOfBetsPlacedOnThisMachineThisRound()
      Should be able to track all bets made on this machine, so that determineWinner method could later erase them and inform if there is a match for a winner.
      void ShouldNotBeAbleToMakeBetWithInsufficientAmount()
      A response from cashier should be appropriate if a bet on a gaming machine is attempted to be made, when money amount is insufficient (gambles more than actually has).
      void ShouldNotBeAbleToMakeBetWithInvalidAmount()
      Due to balance addition logic, where [balance = balance + addition], it must be ensured that no negative values are allowed.
      void ShouldNotBeAbleToPlaceBetWithNoCard()
      A gaming machine should even begin to process bet (inquire with cashier, and then check with round) if there is no connected card at that moment.
      void ShouldNotBeAbleToPlaceBetWithNoConnectedCard()
      Bet should not be placed without connecting a gambler card beforehand.
      void ShouldNotDisconnectCardFromAGamingMachineWithActiveBet()
      Once a bet was placed, a gambling card should not be disconnected until round has finished, this is because gambling machine has an acceptWinner method that should inform a cashier on the amount to be added.
      void ShouldProduceConfirmationIfBetPlacedSuccessfully()
      A gaming machine should produce confirmation if bet was placed successfully That includes internally checking whether cashier confirms that amount is available, and betting round adding bet if it does not exceed allowed count.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • ShouldProduceConfirmationIfBetPlacedSuccessfully

        public void ShouldProduceConfirmationIfBetPlacedSuccessfully()
                                                      throws InvalidAmountException,
                                                             NoPlayerCardException,
                                                             BetNotExceptedException
        A gaming machine should produce confirmation if bet was placed successfully That includes internally checking whether cashier confirms that amount is available, and betting round adding bet if it does not exceed allowed count.
        Throws:
        InvalidAmountException
        NoPlayerCardException
        BetNotExceptedException

      • ShouldNotDisconnectCardFromAGamingMachineWithActiveBet

        public void ShouldNotDisconnectCardFromAGamingMachineWithActiveBet()
                                                            throws CurrentBetMadeException,
                                                                   InvalidAmountException,
                                                                   NoPlayerCardException,
                                                                   BetNotExceptedException
        Once a bet was placed, a gambling card should not be disconnected until round has finished, this is because gambling machine has an acceptWinner method that should inform a cashier on the amount to be added. This can not be done (in current setting) if after bet placement, the card is disconnected. Then even if that bet is deemed winner, machine won't inform.
        Throws:
        CurrentBetMadeException
        InvalidAmountException
        NoPlayerCardException
        BetNotExceptedException

      • ShouldNotBeAbleToPlaceBetWithNoCard

        public void ShouldNotBeAbleToPlaceBetWithNoCard()
                                         throws NoPlayerCardException,
                                                BetNotExceptedException
        A gaming machine should even begin to process bet (inquire with cashier, and then check with round) if there is no connected card at that moment.
        Throws:
        NoPlayerCardException
        BetNotExceptedException

      • ShouldNotBeAbleToMakeBetWithInsufficientAmount

        public void ShouldNotBeAbleToMakeBetWithInsufficientAmount()
                                                    throws InvalidAmountException,
                                                           NoPlayerCardException,
                                                           BetNotExceptedException
        A response from cashier should be appropriate if a bet on a gaming machine is attempted to be made, when money amount is insufficient (gambles more than actually has).
        Throws:
        InvalidAmountException
        NoPlayerCardException
        BetNotExceptedException

      • ShouldNotBeAbleToMakeBetWithInvalidAmount

        public void ShouldNotBeAbleToMakeBetWithInvalidAmount()
                                               throws BetNotExceptedException,
                                                      InvalidAmountException,
                                                      NoPlayerCardException
        Due to balance addition logic, where [balance = balance + addition], it must be ensured that no negative values are allowed.
        Throws:
        BetNotExceptedException
        InvalidAmountException
        NoPlayerCardException

      • ShouldKeepTrackOfBetsPlacedOnThisMachineThisRound

        public void ShouldKeepTrackOfBetsPlacedOnThisMachineThisRound()
                                                       throws NoPlayerCardException,
                                                              BetNotExceptedException,
                                                              InvalidAmountException
        Should be able to track all bets made on this machine, so that determineWinner method could later erase them and inform if there is a match for a winner.
        Throws:
        NoPlayerCardException
        BetNotExceptedException
        InvalidAmountException

      • ShouldEmptyListAfterAround

        public void ShouldEmptyListAfterAround()
                                throws InvalidAmountException,
                                       NoPlayerCardException,
                                       BetNotExceptedException
        A requirement is to have logic, where after a betting round has finished, all bets that were recorded on this machine (person can make several bets), are erased.
        Throws:
        InvalidAmountException
        NoPlayerCardException
        BetNotExceptedException
